title: Linda Robson to return to Loose Women after ‘family problems’
text:
We can’t wait to have her back on our screens (Picture:Meddle/ITV/REX)

Linda Robson has announced her Loose Women return after she took a break due to ‘family problems’.

The 61-year-old actress hasn’t been seen on the daytime show since January amid reports police and medics were called to her home twice in two weeks.

However, she has insisted she is doing ‘fine’ and looking forward to taking her seat on the panel once again.

‘I’m coming back to Loose Women. I had a little break, we had a few problems in the family, but I’m fine,’ she told the Daily Mirror.

‘[I can’t wait for] the gossip in the green room and our little chats. That’s my favourite part – things you never see on air.’

Linda – who is mum Louis and Roberta, with her husband Mark Dunford, 58, and Lauren from a previous relationship – added that a family member had been ill.

Producers on the show are expecting to welcome the Birds of a Feather star back to the panel next year.

The actress will rejoin her pals next year (Picture: Meddle/ITV/REX)

A source said: ‘She is so well loved by viewers and the Loose Women that her place on the panel is always available. It would be great to have her back.

‘She’s a lovely woman who will always be part of the ITV family.’

It was previously claimed emergency services had been called out to Linda as she hadn’t been sleeping well over the festive period.

A spokesperson for the actress declined to comment at the time but the Metropolitan police confirmed they had visited her London home ‘following concerns for an occupant’.

Loose Women airs weekdays at 12.30pm on ITV.
